intro: Cheiridopsis subaequalis, commonly known as the Cape Karoo dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Cheiridopsis subaequalis is often found in rocky soils and is a common sight in the fynbos vegetation of the region.
